command: dd if=/boot/initramfs-$(uname -r).img of=/var/tmp/initramfs.cur bs=1M && md5sum /var/tmp/initramfs.cur baseline/initramfs.img && diff -u <(od -An -tx1 -w16 -v /var/tmp/initramfs.cur) <(od -An -tx1 -w16 -v baseline/initramfs.img)
explanation: Copies the active initramfs and compares both checksum and byte-level hex output to detect unauthorized modifications.
rationale_steps: Copy the initramfs image using dd for consistent block-level reads.
Compute MD5 checksums for a quick comparison against a baseline.
Use od to produce hex dumps and perform a unified diff for precise change visualization.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper use of command separators (&&), process substitution (<()), balanced parentheses, valid flags for all tools (dd, md5sum, diff, od), and correct parameter syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with detecting firmware/image modifications (T1601) by copying the current initramfs, comparing its checksum against a baseline, and performing byte-level comparison to identify any unauthorized changes.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using valid commands, flags, and shell features like command and process substitution with no syntax errors.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While conceptually aligned with detecting image modifications (T1601), the command will operationally fail at the first step due to insufficient privileges to read the initramfs image from `/boot`.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Command is well-formed Bash with valid process substitution, proper flags, and correct chaining operators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It copies the active initramfs and enables detection via hashes and a byte-level diff against a baseline, though the md5sum outputs are not programmatically compared and path assumptions may vary by distro.
